image: What objects are present in the image?
What is the spatial relationship between these objects?
What are these objects interacting with?
What action is the person or animal performing?
What is the environment or setting of the image?
Is there any text visible in the image? If so, what does it say?
What is the dominant color scheme of the image?
text: What are the main entities mentioned in the text?
What events or actions are described in the text?
What is the context or setting of the text?
What is the main idea or purpose of the text?
Are there any explicit or implicit emotions expressed in the text?
What is the cause-effect relationship mentioned in the text?
What are the temporal relationships (e.g., before/after) described?
Are there any metaphors, similes, or symbolic references in the text?
audio: What words or phrases are being spoken in the audio?
Are there any background sounds or noises present (e.g., traffic, music)?
What emotions are conveyed by the speaker's tone of voice?
How many speakers are present? Who are they?
What activity or environment is the audio likely captured in?
What actions or events are implied by the audio content?
Is there overlapping speech or dialogue between speakers?
What is the language or dialect being spoken?
Are there any non-verbal cues (e.g., laughter, sighs) in the audio?
Is there any music or specific sound effects present?
